DataElement.preferredName: Complication During Localization Technique Occurrence Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the complication that occurred during the localization technique.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure._At some point in a given period of time._The process of determining or marking the location or site of a lesion or disease. May also refer to the process of keeping a lesion or disease in a specific location or site._A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Complication; any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of (or because of) another disease.

Concepts.definition: Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.

Property.preferredDefinition: At some point in a given period of time.:The process of determining or marking the location or site of a lesion or disease. May also refer to the process of keeping a lesion or disease in a specific location or site.:A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.:An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

Concepts.definition: At some point in a given period of time.
The process of determining or marking the location or site of a lesion or disease.
A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Position or arrangement, as of the teeth; the state of being placed or arranged, as the assignment of a person to a appropriate clinical study.: A hollow tube that is inserted into the pleural space through a surgical incision in the chest wall.

Concepts.definition: Position or arrangement, as of the teeth; the state of being placed or arranged, as the assignment of a person to a appropriate clinical study.
A hollow tube that is inserted into the pleural space through a surgical incision in the chest wall.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An immune response that occurs following re-exposure to an innocuous antigen, and that requires the presence of existing antibodies against that antigen. This response involves the binding of IgE to mast cells, and may worsen with repeated exposures.

Concepts.definition: An immune response that occurs following re-exposure to an innocuous antigen, and that requires the presence of existing antibodies against that antigen. This response involves the binding of IgE to mast cells, and may worsen with repeated exposures.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cardiac arrest that is treated by CPR and/or defibrillation, regardless of outcome.

Concepts.definition: Cardiac arrest that is treated by CPR and/or defibrillation, regardless of outcome.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The administration of blood or blood products into a blood vessel.

Concepts.definition: The injection of whole blood or a blood component directly into the bloodstream.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.2.2 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002006. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: None of the choices above are suitable.

Concepts.definition: None of the choices above are suitable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A procedure to remove toxic substances from the blood that is used in patients with end-stage chronic kidney disease or acute kidney failure. This includes hemodialysis and peritoneal dialysis._Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory._An acute or chronic condition that is characterized by the inability of the kidneys to adequately filter the blood.

Concepts.definition: A procedure to remove toxic substances from the blood that is used in patients with end-stage chronic kidney disease or acute kidney failure. This includes hemodialysis and peritoneal dialysis.
Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.
An acute or chronic condition that is characterized by the inability of the kidneys to adequately filter the blood.

PermissibleValues.value: Severe pulmonary symptoms requiring intubation or ventilator support

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intubation Procedure Or Ventilator Requirement Severe Lung Disorder
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The insertion of a cannula or tube into a hollow body organ._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A medical device that facilitates breathing._Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory._Intensely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent._A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the lung. Representative examples of non-neoplastic disorders include chronic obstructive pulmonary disease and pneumonia. Representative examples of neoplastic disorders include benign processes (e.g., respiratory papilloma) and malignant processes (e.g., lung carcinoma and metastatic cancer to the lung).

Concepts.definition: The insertion of a cannula or tube into a hollow body organ.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A medical device that facilitates breathing.
Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.
Intensely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.

A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the lung. Representative examples of non-neoplastic disorders include chronic obstructive pulmonary disease and pneumonia. Representative examples of neoplastic disorders include benign processes (e.g., respiratory papilloma) and malignant processes (e.g., lung carcinoma and metastatic cancer to the lung).
